intro: Epilobium squamosum, commonly known as the scaly willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems that are often covered in small, scale-like structures. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with four petals and are arranged in clusters. Epilobium squamosum is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and other moist environments.
